intro: Vitis inaequalis, commonly known as the wild grapevine, is a species native to the southeastern United States. It is a climbing vine with compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, sour-tasting berries that are typically not consumed by humans. It has a woody stem and can grow in a variety of soil types. Vitis inaequalis is often found in woodland areas and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
